description: Borrowed from French dragon. Doublet of Draco and dragon.

entries.meaning: (military) A horse soldier; a cavalryman, who uses a horse for mobility, but fights dismounted.
examples: If you want a receipt for that popular mystery,Known to the world as a Heavy Dragoon -Take all the remarkable people in history,Rattle them off to a popular tune!

entries.meaning: A carrier of a dragon musket.

examples: Dragoons were originally bred between a Tumbler and a Horseman: by frequently matching them with the Horseman, they will acquire very great strength and agility

verbs.description: dragoon (third-person singular simple present dragoons, present participle dragooning, simple past and past participle dragooned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To force (someone) into doing something; to coerce.
(transitive) To surrender (a person) to the fury of soldiers.
